commits.message:
nydus: cleanup

Cleanup created nydus snapshots and var directory

Fixes: #5787

Signed-Off-By: Ryan Savino <ryan.savino@amd.com>

Merge pull request #5788 from ryansavino/nydus-cleanup

nydus: add var directory cleanup

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,7 @@ main () {
 	sudo systemctl stop "${CRI_RUNTIME}"
 
 	sudo kill -9 $(pidof "containerd-nydus-grpc") || true
+	sudo rm -rf "/var/lib/containerd-nydus" || true
comment.body: Sure thing. Also, I moved the nydus snapshot cleanup to right before the CRI_RUNTIME stop call. In case this might cause any issues.

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -41,6 +41,7 @@ main () {
 	sudo systemctl stop "${CRI_RUNTIME}"
 
 	sudo kill -9 $(pidof "containerd-nydus-grpc") || true
+	sudo rm -rf "/var/lib/containerd-nydus" || true
comment.body:
@ryansavino, as part of the cleanup, I'd also add:
```
for i in `sudo ctr -n k8s.io snapshot --snapshotter nydus list | grep -v KEY | cut -d' ' -f1`; do sudo ctr -n k8s.io snapshot --snapshotter nydus rm $i; done
```

issue.title: Intermittent nydus error complaining about already existing key

labels.name: needs-review
labels.description: Needs to be assessed by the team.

issue.body:
This error pops up intermittently in the CI (potentially user space) when the pods are launched:

```
Error: failed to create containerd container: create instance 1726: object with key "1726" already exists: unknown
```

This appears to be affecting multiple host types.

pull_request.title: CC | tests: Set io.containerd.cri.runtime-handler annotation
pull_request.body:
The CRI PullImage does not have a "runtime class" input, and this is being discussed at the kubernetes level on:
* https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/pull/4217
* https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/118907

For now, we're forced to pass the specific annotation to containerd.

repo.name: kata-tests
repo.description: Kata Containers tests, CI, and metrics

repo.name: tests
repo.description: Kata Containers tests, CI, and metrics

commits.message:
tests: Set io.containerd.cri.runtime-handler annotation

The CRI PullImage does not have a "runtime class" input, and this is
being discussed at the kubernetes level on:
* https://github.com/kubernetes/enhancements/pull/4217
* https://github.com/kubernetes/kubernetes/pull/118907

For now, we're forced to pass the specific annotation to containerd.

Signed-off-by: Fabiano Fidêncio <fabiano.fidencio@intel.com>

agent_image: Update the expected error message

The error message will be different depending on the containerd version
being used. :-/

Signed-off-by: Fabiano Fidêncio <fabiano.fidencio@intel.com>

Merge pull request #5785 from fidencio/topic/CC-set-io.containerd.cri.runtime.handler-annotation

CC | tests: Set io.containerd.cri.runtime-handler annotation

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -164,7 +164,10 @@ setup() {
 
 	assert_pod_fail "${pod_config}"
 
-	assert_logs_contain "containerd" 'failed to resolve reference \\"quay.io/kata-containers/confidential-containers-auth:test\\": pulling from host quay.io failed with status code \[manifests test\]: 401 UNAUTHORIZED'
+	# The error will be different depending on the containerd version being used.
+	# The former assert is the one coming from containerd 1.6.x, while the latter is the cone coming from 1.7.x
comment.body: As you marked it as a nit, I will save some trees and avoid re-running the CIs as they take a at least an hour, thanks for the review though

For now, we're forced to pass the specific annotation to containerd.

commits.message:
ci: Ensure we have yq installed

There was a recent change on the Kata Containers side that ended up
breaking our CI here as yq is not automagically installed anymore.

Signed-off-by: Fabiano Fidêncio <fabiano.fidencio@intel.com>
(cherry picked from commit 6bf08c833e3663cdff81e75b446325326bec500c)

Fixes: #5770 -- But not really, it was part of the PR that fixed 5770,
but we're only backporting this patch.

Depends-on: github.com/kata-containers/kata-containers#7914

Merge pull request #5786 from fidencio/topic/stable-3.2-backports

stable-3.2 | ci: Ensure we have yq installed
